intro: Bidens mayebarae, commonly known as the Mexican ironweed, is a flowering plant native to parts of Central America and northern South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as grasslands and wetlands. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped with serrated edges, and the flowers are yellow with prominent central disks. Bidens mayebarae is often used in traditional medicine for its purported anti-inflammatory properties.
